newsitem.title: USA: Merrill Lynch to add 2,000 jobs - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Merrill Lynch to add 2,000 jobs - WSJ.

text.p: In exchange for more than $28 million in tax breaks, Merrill Lynch & Co Inc has promised to add 2,000 jobs in New York, the Wall Street Journal said.

In Friday's electronic edition, the Journal said that Merrill Lynch, one of New York City's largest employers with 9,000 people, plans to hire the additional staff largely as middle managers and back-office workers.
The financial incentives from the state and city are to be used toward the company's $73 million purchase of a 31-story building at 222 Broadway.
